doc.title: Earnings Previews (Li Auto, Tuopu, Sanhu), HHI & Mipo Merger, NVDA & Asia AI DC Trade, Key News (CN Auto launch)
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/JPM/JPM APAC Industrial Auto 828 ---Earnings Previews Li Auto Tuopu Sanhu HHI Mipo Merger NVDA Asia AI DC Trade Key News CN _2025-08-28

passages.text: I will be attending our Japan Industrial & Technology Conference today & tomorrow with multiple key Autos & Industrial companies. There will be no daily tomorrow with a short one today. Big focus of yesterday post market was HD Hyundai Heavy & Mipo merger announcement. Simon Han found merger as group shifting currents toward defense & flags future naval order visibility to be key re-rating catalysts (Link). Post the call, general investors feedback was positive from a business stand point with most efforts trying to understand quantified upside to its future order book or earnings. (Simon looks at $4-6bn/yr Rev upside from US Naval biz that translates to 20-30% of HHI + Mipo’s 2027E Rev based on cons est with non-US naval biz upside w/ HHI & Hanwha in the bidding process for projects that worth $50-60bn. Assuming 25% winning ratio, non-US orders to add 30-45% upside to HHI + Mipo’s combined existing order book. Would love to hear your thoughts and feedback on this one too!
- **Earnings Previews for Today: LI Auto, Tuopu, Sanhua**
- **Hyundai Heavy Group** - Shifting Currents toward defense; future naval order visibility to be key re-rating catalysts - Simon Han (Link)
- **AI DC Trade: NVDA Print reads/feedback** (Paige Hanson - US Industrial Spec); Guidance + H20 soft guide (~$56-59bn) well-received by bulls

- **China Battery Materials Anti-Involution Call Series (Sep 2-3)** - Rebecca Wen; 7 calls on copper foil, LFP cathode, and separator Register here (Calls are for Mifi high touch and out of scope clients only.)
- **(Key News)China Auto New Launch; Xpeng P7 & Shangjie (Huawei X SAIC) H5**

Save the Dates: J.P.Morgan Industrials Events
Earnings Previews for Today: LI Auto, Tuopu, Sanhua

- LI Auto(8/28): Nick expects Li Auto 2Q25 NP to be 1,298mn RMB (in-line with Cons of 1,292mn NP, Cons revised down by \(-5\%\) in past 4wks) with Vehicle GPM of \(19\%\) (vs cons of \(19.3\%\) ). Nick recently downgraded Li Auto to N cutting Li's sales volume to grow \(-5\%\) YoY in 2025 ( \(-480\mathrm{k}\) units vs BBG cons of \(-570\mathrm{k}\) units) to grow \(35\%\) YoY in 2026 to reach 640K units (vs BBG cons of 720-730K units). With latest Nio's successful launch of Onvo L90 to compete with LI's i8 & upcoming launch of Huawei x Seres launch of M8 EV (Aug 25 soft launch, Benchmark L9, potentially to compete w/ i8) sentiment of Li likely further weighed. JPM N, PT of US\$28. Next focus/catalyst of the stock will be it's i6 launch in Sep with expected px RMB 240-250K. JPM N, HK\$114/US\$28.

- Tuopu(8/28): Rebecca Wen expects \(+15\% y / y\) rev growth in 2Q25 (above cons of \(+11.8\%\) YoY) & NPM of \(10.3\%\) (slightly above cons of \(10.1\%\) ). Back in June 13, Rebecca upgraded Tuopu on the back of key customers volume recovery (Tesla and Seres. especially Seres) while 1Q25 result miss reset investors' expectation. While Tuopu share px has been trading mostly in-line with Tesla's share price until recent breakout on the back of growing hope on Tesla Y (6 seater launch) in China & upcoming Humanoid robot update expectation. JPM OW, PT of 56 RMB

- Sanhua (8/28): Sanhua pre-announced Rev/ NPAT growth of \(21\%\) Y/Y & \(36\%\) Y/Y at mid-point, continuing the growth momentum from 1Q despite China-US policy uncertainties & sluggish Tesla sales. With 2Q strong beat on announced pre-results, Karen sees limited downside risk to its full year guidance. In the coming earnings, key KPIs to look for are Sanhua's Auto segment sales & GPM while we believe Sanhua remains well positioned for Long-term growth in the humanoid robot industry (Karen expects global humanoid robot industry TAM of 5bn units over next decade at her UBTech Initiation), with Sanhua actively seeking collaborations with other OEMs both within and outside of China, mitigating concerns over Teslabot's supply chain adjustments. JPM OW with PT of RMB 38. Note mixed feedback on Sanhua heading into its earnings, mainly on Teslabot supply chain adjustment. JPM OW, RMB of 38.
Hyundai Heavy Group - Shifting Currents toward defense; future naval order visibility to be key re- rating catalysts - Simon Han (Link)

- Simon Han is positive on announced merger: This move clearly shows the group's change in business structure from commercial-centric to higher exposure to the navy business, and the company will utilize its key assets under Mipo and overseas subsidiaries. We have been believing a re-rating for KR shipbuilders to come from the defense angle (note).

- Our Key Takeaways from the mgmt call: (1) the company's high conviction in navy demand not just for the US, but also for the rest of the world; (2) agile capacity expansion and utilization of commercial docks to help grow navy-related revenue from W1F in 2025 to W10T by 2035; and (3) the company's confidence in profitability, given its unmatched cost-competitiveness. My off the calls note here too

- Key Qs & feedback from investors: Most effort to quantify upside on its market cap. Simon believes US naval defense biz to add \(34-6bn annual revenue upside, which is 20-30\%\) of HHI + Mipo's 2027E Rev based on cons est. Simon expects upside from non-US defense business can be also additive (which merged entity is also focusing on). \(\)50-60bn\(worth of non\) \mathbb{U} \(s defense projects including Canada CPSP submarine project that KR players (mainly HHI & Hanwha) are bidding for are out there to add up to it's order back log (HHI current order backlog stands at US\) 34.3B, Hyundai Mipo order backlog stands at US\) 9.8B). Assuming HHI could win 25% of bidding that they are targeting for non-US orders to add 30-45% upside to HHI + Mipo's combined existing order book. While general feedback of investors were positive on the merger, most non-holders found rally since mid- July (+20% Mipo, +32% for HHI) captures most initial positives and find it hard to chase from here, but waiting for a pull-back to find a better entry point.
- initial positives and find it hard to chase from here, but waiting for a pull-back to find a better entry point.
Al/Data Center Trade: NVDA Print Read/ Feedback - Guide + H20 Soft guide (- \(56-59bn\) ) well-received by bulls - Paige Hanson (US Industrial Spec)

- Headline Missed on high-buyside Bars but better details w/ potential \(\)5bn\(upside in H20 Rev: NVDA shares dropped -4% initially with many KPIs missing our teams busyide bars and headline disappointment on the data center rev result, but shares recovered into the call and that trend has only continued given updates/commentary learned on the call

so far. To that point, my semis/hardware counterpart Josh Meyers (US hardware/Semi Spec) noting investor feedback inbound to him has continued to improve during the call, particularly after NVDA shared that if geopolitical issues reside they expect to ship up to \(\) 5B\$ in H20 revenue in 3Q, since the 2Q result as well as guide is ex H20/China, which is one of the reasons the light DC rev nuer was looked through (also on the timing of GB200 ramp slower and what Josh described in his first take tonight as small air pocket and not a surprise given the known slower ramp)

Overall commentary on demand side remains strong: Investors are viewing the guide \(+\) H20 soft guide on the call to be \(\) 56- 59\(B, well - received by bulls. Overall commentary on the demand side in the release is strong, which is key for the strength of this AI trade broadly and on the call mgmt noted they see "three to four trillion dollars in AI infrastructure by the end of the decade".

Investors Feedback on Asia AI & Data Center Trade: We note investors post 2Q25 earnings turned incrementally more confident on AI/Data Center trade in Asia with investors broadening their choice of investment into other names (Hysoung Heavy/ LS Electric) from their core winners (HItachi/HD Hyundai Electric) in the space. Despite this week's flow has been quiet into NVDA earnings (with high- bysides bars), investors were adding AI trades on dip in the recent round of momo unwind- driven correction with better confidence level seen than the last round of momo unwind. However, worth noting increasing incomings on Hitachi & HD Hyundai Electric about their earnings potential upside risk (if any) while investors seeing limited upside risk throughout this yr in their earnings.

Our JP desk is highlighting Fujitsu saying its 'AI Agent' opportunity is not in the price (yet), expecting potential shift from NEC \(\rightarrow\) Fujitsu with Fujitsu trading at cheaper valuation (21X FY26 vs NEC of 24X). Next catalyst is Fujitsu IR day on Sep 9 where Ayada- san thinks that we can get more details on its Uvance & AI agents- driven upside to highlight their growth structural stories while cyclical drivers slowing for NEC could slow into next year (Though Ayadasan sees upside risk in this yr's number driven by strong public sector - NEC)

China has it's own 'AI +' framework announced: Aiming to boost development of INTELLIGENT VEHICLES and ROBOTS with financial support to boot. Our China desk highlighting local power management companies as laggard (002851CH and 002484 CH) to potentially see boost on top of already rallied key AI names & Robotic names. I would like also highlight our related push here is Weichai Power set to capture strong structural TAM AI DC back up power engine growth in China with m/s gain. (Global Machinery - Powering Data centers from US to China)

Over the past two months, Chinese lithium carbonate prices have surged by over \(30\%\) from their lowest point, possibly as part of China's anti- involution campaign. In response, several battery material subsectors have convened industry meetings to discuss future steps and strategies. We have invited key players from these subsectors, where anti- involution industry meetings have taken place, to share insights on the discussions held by industry associations and their perspectives on pricing and capital expenditure outlooks. Join us for conversations with leading players in the LFP cathode, separator, and copper foil industries. We will spend 30 mins with each company with a focus on anti- involution.
Calls are for Miffd high touch and out of scope clients only.

Key News: China Auto New Launch; Xpeng P7 & Shangjie (Huawei X SAIC) H5

Xpeng launches next gen P7 starting at \(\) 30,700\(, securing 10K orders within 7 mins (Cnevpost): Co rolled out the new P7 with starting price of RMB 219.8K (\) 30,700) significantly below previous indicative price of RMB 300K to secure 10K new- generation P7 order within the first 7 minutes. Order- numbers look decent considering P7's peak monthly sales post last time of launch \(\sim 10K / month to stabilize around 6 - 7K / month level with 60,569 units sold in 2021, 59,066 sold in 2022 accounting
\(61.7\% /48.9\%\) of XPeng's annual deliveries in 2021/2022. We note investors sentiment shifting on Xpeng post 2Q earnings with P7 successful launch ysday adding

- Huawei-backed Shangjie (SAIC) H5 Securities over 50K pre-orders within 18 hours of pre-sales (Cnevpost): Shangjie H5, pre-sales starting price set at RMB 169,800 RMB, the most affordable model under Huawei's HIMA business. The vehicle received over 25K pre-orders within the first hour of its pre-sales launch & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & & 400,000 units annually to its supply chain based on future model planning, local media outlet 36kr reported yesterday.

- GEV: Insider sold shares worth \(\) 2\mathrm{mn}\$ according to a recent SEC filing (BBG)- US approves potential \(\) 103.9\mathrm{mn}\$ sales of Sidewinder missiles to NATO (Reuters)- China NEV retail at 727K in Aug 1-24, up 6% YoY (Cnevpost)- Europe's Zero Emission Targets are "No Longer Feasible" (Reuters)- US Warships able to be manufactured in South Korea (DongA): According to multiple government sources on the 27th, the U.S. Department of the Navy expressed this position during a meeting with KR government earlier this month, discussing cooperation plans for the construction of warships to strengthen U.S. naval power. In response, the Defense Acquisition Program Administration and the U.S. Department of the Navy are planning to hold a working group meeting in Sep in the U.S. to discuss specific regulatory relaxation measures to be included in administrative orders

- Mitsubishi Motors (7211): FY25 Guidance Cut: In-line with our estimates, but poor substance gives negative impression - Akira Kishimoto (Link)- MInth: Solid revenue and earnings growth - Rebecca Wen (Link)- Shenzhen Innovance - Briefing takeaways highlight Innovance's confidence in FA cycle recovery and expansion into new market segments - Karen Li (Link)- Nari Technology - First Take: 1H25 results - Revenue beat but margin missed; profit growth in-line - Stephen Tsui (Link)- United Tractor (UNTR IJ) - Key Takeaways from 1H25 earnings call: Muted Outlook; Stay N on Valuation - Henry Wibowo (Link)- IJM: First TAke - 1QFY26 missed on weak property and ports - Yen Voo (Link)

- Hyundai Heavy Group: Shifting Currents toward defense; future naval order visibility to be key re-rating catalysts - Simon Han (Link)- EE/MI: HAVC Industry update: Further thoughts on News of EPA's reconsideration of Technology Transition Rule and Low probability of major changes - Steve Tusa (Link)
